lines.text: [repeated line]
Take chances, make mistakes, get messy!

[theme song opening]
Seatbelts, everyone!
*Please* let this be a normal field trip.
With the Frizz? No way!
[repeated line]
What are we gonna do, what are we gonna do, what are we gonna do?
[repeated line, after Carlos makes a joke]
Carlos!
[repeated line]
Okay, bus, do your stuff!
[repeated line]
According to my research...
[repeated line]
To the bus!
[repeated line]
At my old school...
I *knew* I should've stayed home today!

I might have made a mistake about that lizard. And I might have made a mistake about that jackrabbit. And I might have even made a mistake about that tortoise, but there's one thing I know I'm not wrong about.
How much you wish you'd stayed home today?
It's too cold.
I guess there's no heater in a bus-igator because it's a reptile.
Then move the bus-igator to where it's warmer.

[Engine won't turn over]
I can't do that either. The bus-igator isn't working.
It's probably too cold, that's why.

[on their way to the sound museum]
So what if the sound of Carlos's instrument stays...
[instrument sounds of rattles, grinds, and groans]
...just like that?
Ooh, our concerto will be ruined. All the other schools will laugh at us, and it'll be the end of the world as we know it. Other than that, nothing.
C'mon, Arnold, let him go. It's just an egg.
But it's Dr. Skeledon's egg. And it's up to me to get it back to her!
Gee, what a guy!
[repeated line]
Come on, you weasley wimps!
Ralphie the Magnificent!
It's not bowing.
Would you blame it? I wouldn't either.
[the class is stuck in the water cycle, and they end up in the girls' bathroom through the plumbing]
Hey, your bathroom is way nicer than ours!
I know Arnold likes rocks, but do you really think he'd swallow one?
Ms. Frizzle could be on Saturn, couldn't she?
Okay, Arnold, but it's YOUR job to keep your crazy cousin under control!
Cheer up, Arnold. A famous poet once said, "All the world's a field trip, and all the kids in our class are merely guinea pigs"... or did Ms. Frizzle say that?

[of the robot]
He doesn't move or bend!
He doesn't do anything!
Haha! Just like Ralphie!
That's not blood, that's tomato juice! Like Ms. Frizzle served at the class picnic!

[about an asteroid]
Look! A flying potato!

[reading the feeding chart at a reptile health spa]
Feed the lizards only once a week? And the alligators only once a month! How inhumane!
Arnold told me all about your field trips, Dorothy Ann.

[alarmed]
What did he say!
That they were, and I quote, "highly unusual".
Anybody have a good Plan B?
There aren't any good Plan Bs, Tim! If they were good, they'd be Plan As!
There, you don't look nearly so orange now.
[giggles]

[looks at reflection]
Phoebe! I can't go out there covered in flour! I look like a pumpkin pie!

[after Arnold has just saved the class from a T-Rex]
It's a good thing you didn't stay home today, Arnold!
It must be cold down there because Saturn's pretty far away from the sun.
But Ms. Frizzle said "cold and dark".
It could be very, very dark on Saturn!
Oh, no you don't! You just want to grab more stuff!
Hey, I'm just trying to help! If you want to play "Let's Find Ms. Frizzle Without A Map" for the rest of your life, that's *fine* with me!

[on doing a slam dunk]
If only I could just do it once, just to see what it feels like!
Patience, Wanda, fishing is an art.
So is tightrope walking, but we don't have time to learn it.
What're we gonna do? What're we gonna do? What're we gonna do?
Wanda, what're we gonna do?
At my old school, we never rode on bees.
We *are* at your old school, Pheobe.
Oh, right.
At my old school, we'd use a bulldozer to move heavy things.
That's *great*, Phoebe. And where're we supposed to get a bulldozer?

[to Ms. Frizzle]
Well, no one's more important than you, my little togglebolt.
My little togglebolt?
Something tells me we shouldn't be here.
Like what?
[they wake up a Tyrannosaurus Rex]
Like that!
We know the real reason why you make a complete wimp like a butterfly as a mascot.
You do?
We do?
Isn't today's soccer game against... your old school?
Well, you know what they say - bat breath is better than no breath at all!
[laughs]
Mr. Ramon!
At Phoebe's old school, we never took field trips.
[Ms. Frizzle is taking the parents through a bat-filled castle]
What *is* that smell?
That's bat poop, Mr. Perlstein. Better get used to it!
Maybe we should have stayed home tonight.

[overhearing further down the cave]
Dad! You took the words right out of my mouth!
[repeated line]
Is it just me or...
[repeated line]
Let's get the facts...
I knew I should've ...
Don't say it, Arnold!
Don't feel bad, Phoebe. Only a giant spider could trap that general.
Yes! Arnold, you're a genius!

[Phoebe doesn't want Mr. Seedplot to find them]
Maybe *you* should have stayed home today, Phoebe.
It's simple. All we have to do is build a robot that looks like me.

[holds a hubcap up to his face]
Like this?
